free: #e I’m going to tell a story, starting from keeping a frog.
#c 我要講一個關於養青蛙的故事。

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e There is a child who keeps a frog and a dog.
#c 有一個小孩養了一隻青蛙和一隻狗。

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e This child looks at his frog in the bottle and that dog.
#c 這個小孩看著他在瓶子裡的青蛙，還有狗。

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e Looking at his frog and that dog, he feels happy, and...
#c 看著他的青蛙和狗，很高興，然後… (FLIPPING THE PAGE)

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e And when the night falls, this child also falls asleep.
#c 到了晚上，這個小孩睡著了。

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e And it turns out that his frog runs away, perhaps (because) this child has fallen asleep in the late evening.
#c 結果他的青蛙跑走了，可能(因為)小孩晚上在睡覺。
#n qaRabi = tuRabi ‘evening’晚上 vs. qaRatuRabi ‘late evening’深夜
#n Rabi=ti ka ‘It’s dark.’天黑了
#n tuRabi=ti qena-Rabi-an ‘It’s quite late in the evening.’已經很晚了。

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e And after waking up in the morning, he looks into the bottle for that frog, but it is gone?!
#c 早上醒來後，他看瓶子裡的青蛙，結果不見了。

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e ‘Oh, where is my frog?,’ said this child.
#c 這個小孩說，oh，我的青蛙在哪裡?

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e So this child goes searching, searching for his frog.
#c 這個小孩去找，去找他的青蛙。

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e This child thinks, ‘Ooh, it’s probably inside the shoes.’
#c 這個小孩可能想說，可能在我的拖鞋，鞋子裡面。
#n zpu = kucu 日語借詞 (a Japanese load word)

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e He goes turning over his shoes, or his rain boots perhaps, to search for the frog.
#c 他翻他的鞋子，或可能是他的雨鞋，要找青蛙。
#n amagucu ‘rain boots’雨鞋，日語借詞 (Japanese loan word)

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)

free: #e As for the dog, it thinks that (the frog) is probably in the bottle.
#c 那個狗想說可能在瓶子裡。

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e So it squeezes his head into the bottle, where the frog once resided.
#c 狗把頭鑽進瓶子裡，青蛙曾住過的地方。

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e And the dog can’t take, can’t pull out its head.
#c 狗不能拿..不能把頭拔出來。

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e And then that child goes searching for the frog, accompanied by his dog.
#c 小孩去找青蛙，跟狗一起。

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e It turns out that the dog is wears the bottle on its head, where the frog once resided.
#c 結果狗把瓶子戴在頭上，青蛙曾經住過的地方。
#n si-kubu: 把~套/戴在頭上 to wear on the head (FLIPPING PAGE)

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)

free: #e At this point (when it (i.e. the story) comes here), the child is yelling out for the frog.
#c 到了這裡，小孩在叫青蛙。

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e The dog also keeps barking and barking and search for the frog.
#c 狗也在叫，也在找青蛙。

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e And it turns out that the dog falls down off the window.
#c 結果狗從窗戶掉下去。

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)

free: #e When following the man to yell out for the frog, the dog falls down, and..
#c 那個狗跟著那個人，叫青蛙，然後掉下去了。

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e The bottle that the dog wears on its head breaks (into pieces).
#c 狗戴在頭上的瓶子破了。

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e At this point (when it comes here), the bottle is gone (off the dog’s head).
#c 到了這邊，瓶子沒有了。

free: #e Perhaps because those wasps see this person and this dog, they keep coming out (of their nest), wanting to sting this person and this child.
#c 這些蜜蜂看到小孩和狗，就一直跑出來，想要咬這個人和這個小孩。
#n 講錯，應該是wasu（狗）。Note: The “sunis (child)” here should have been “wasu (dog)” but the narrator made a mistake.

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e This child is afraid (of the wasps).
#c 這個小孩很害怕。

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)

free: #e At this point (when it comes here), (he) really sees those wasps.
#c 到了這邊，真的看到蜜蜂了。

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e Those wasps are high above.
#c 那些蜜蜂在上面。

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e Afraid of those wasps, this child crouches down.
#c 小孩蹲下來，(因為)怕蜜蜂。

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e That dog is barking.
#c 那隻狗在叫。

meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e This child is barking up at the wasps.
#c 小孩向上對蜜蜂叫。
#n The “sunis (child)” here should have been “wasu (dog)” but the narrator made a mistake.

#c 到了這邊，小孩怕這些蜜蜂，就哭了。

#c 這個小孩可能想說，我的青蛙可能在這裡，(所以)它往洞裡瞧，(可是)青蛙不在那裡。

free: #e The child is there on the top of the rock.

free: #e All of a sudden, onto the head of the deer climbs this child.

free: #n 我原本住在PakteRungan，後來已經搬到台北了。
#n mau nizi=iku ta pakteRungan tu matalin=iku pasa taypaq ‘I previously lived in PakteRungan, and then I moved to Taipei.’
#n 我原本住在PakteRungan，後來已經搬到台北了。
#n mau nizi=iku ta pakteRungan tu matalin=iku pasa taypaq ‘I previously lived in PakteRungan, and then I moved to Taipei.’

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e At this point (when it comes here), the child previously on the head of the deer turns out to fall down.
#c 到了這邊，小孩原本在鹿的頭上，結果掉下來了。

free: #e Perhaps the deer thinks, “The child is falling down.”
#c 鹿可能想說，小孩掉下去了。

free: #e His dog is also (falling down), as well as the mouse…, what is this?

free: #e His feet are up in the air.

free: #e His head (plunges) into the water.

free: #e At this point (when it comes here), the child as well as his dog has come out of the water.
#c 到了這邊，小孩和狗從水裡出來了。

free: #e And then the child comes out of the water, carrying his dog on his back.
#c 這個小孩背著他的狗，從水裡出來。

free: #e Perhaps because the dog is about to bark, the man, the child says to his dog, “Be quiet! Don’t talk! Don’t make any sound.”
#c 可能狗要叫，小孩就對他的狗說，安靜!不要說話，不要出聲。

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)

free: #e So his dog keeps quiet.
#c 他的狗安靜了。

#c 到了這邊，(他們)爬樹。

free: #e At this point (when it comes here), when that child and that dog are on top of the tree, they see their frog.
#c 到了這邊，小孩和狗在樹上，他們看到他們的青蛙。

free: #e “Oh, our frog is here,” the child and the dog perhaps think so.
#c “喔，我們的青蛙在這裡”，小孩和狗可能這樣想。

meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e (They) feel happy.
#c (他們)很高興。

free: #e At this point (when it comes here) on one tree, the frogs show up, and that’s perhaps (why) that child felt happy.
#c 到了這邊，在一棵樹上，青蛙出現了，小孩或許覺得很高興。

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e The dog and the child is very happy right here.
#c 小孩和狗在這邊很高興。

free: #e At this point (when it comes here), that child is looking afar at those frogs on the tree.
#c 到了這邊，小孩望著在樹上的青蛙。
#n maRaw-an-na=iku ni abas: Abas望著我 Abas looked at me.
#n qaRaw-an-ku ti-abas: 我幫Abas抓癢 I scratched Abas' itch.
#n q<em>aRaw=iku ti-abas-an: 我幫Abas抓癢 I scratched Abas' itch.

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e There are frogs on the tree.
#c 樹上有青蛙。

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e This child is sitting directly on the ground, along with his dog.
#c 這個小孩坐在地上。

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e And then there are…, well, we don’t know how to put this.
#c 有…ㄜ..我不知道我們怎麼說。
#n “q<m>uni smani”搭配詞，表示講者對所說的話的真假不是很確定。“q<m>uni smani” is a frequent collocation, which roughly expresses the uncertainty a speaker holds towards his or her utterances.
#n ninu zin-ku sikawma smani: 我不知道說的是什麼 I don't know what is being said.
#n ninu zin-su smani zin-ku: 我不知道你說什麼 I don't know what you are saying.

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e Seeing those frogs, this child perhaps feels happy.
#c 看到這些青蛙，小孩很高興。

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e His hands are up in the air, like (he’s) clapping his hands maybe.
#c 他的手舉起來，可能好像在拍手。
#n piqpiq-an-na sunis-na: 用手掌打孩子 slap the child
#n patepiq: 一巴掌 slap

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e He felt happy that he found out the frog.
#c 他很高興他找到青蛙了。
#n pakala-an-ku=ti sudad-ku: 我找到我的書了 I found my book.

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e Is it over?
#c 沒了嗎?

meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e It’s over.
#c 沒了。
